Note:
Rules are included in the [b]Notebook[/b] ([0080FF]blue icon[-] in upper bar) which has links to the orignal developers of "Secret Hitler" (see CREDITS).

There is also a "How to..." section in case you wonder how to secretly acknowledge Fascists and Hitler with blindfolds. Have a look at the other howtos aswell.

[u]Orignal developers of "Secret Hitler"[/u]:
[FF0000]Max Temkin,
Mike Boxleiter,
Tommy Maranges.
[-]Illustrated by [FF0000]Mackenzie Schubert.[-]

More information under [00FF00]secrethitler.com[-]

This Tabletop Simulator Mod is made by [b]FragaholiC[/b]

0.title: Secret Hitler
0.body:
Welcome to pre-WWII Germany. In Secret Hitler, players German politicians attempting to hold a fragile Liberal government together and stem the rising tide of fascism. Watch out though - there are secret fascists among you, and someone is Secret Hitler.

[u][b]OVERVIEW[/b][/u]

At the beginning of the game, each player is secretly assigned to one of three roles: Liberal, Fascist, or Hitler. Hitler plays for the fascist team, and the fascists know who Hitler is, but most of the time Hitler does not know who his fellow fascists are. The Liberals don’t know who anyone is. The liberals win by enacting five liberal policies or killing Hitler. The fascists win by enacting six fascist policies, or if Hitler is elected chancellor late in the game. As Fascist policies are enacted, the government becomes more powerful and the President gains new powers. Even liberal players
may find themselves tempted to enact fascist policies that help them control the table and assassinate their enemies.

20.title: Object
20.body:
[u][b]OBJECT[/b][/u]

Every player is secretly on the Liberal team or the Fascist team.

The game ends in a [b]Liberal Victory[/b] if either:

   [b]>[/b] Five liberal policies are enacted.
   [b]>[/b] Hitler is assassinated.

The game ends in a [b]Fascist Victory[/b] if either:

   [b]>[/b] Six fascist policies are enacted.
   [b]>[/b] Hitler wins an election as chancellor any time
      after the third fascist policy has been enacted.

30.title: Set Up
30.body:
[u][b]SET UP[/b][/u]

Select the Fascist Track that corresponds to the number of players and place it next to a Liberal Track (there’s an identical Liberal track on the back of every Fascist track). Shuffle the 11 Fascist policy mini-cards and the 6 Liberal mini-policy cards into a single policy deck and place the deck face down on the [b]DRAW[/b] card.

You’ll need an envelope for each player, and each envelope should contain a Secret Role card, a corresponding Party Membership card, and two Ballot cards. Use the table below to determine the correct distribution of Roles.

[b]PLAYERS # |   5   |   6   |   7   |   8   |   9   |   10[/b]
[b]-----------------------------------------------------[/b]
Liberals      |   3   |   4   |   4   |   5   |   5   |   6
[b]-----------------------------------------------------[/b]
Fascists      | 1+H | 1+H | 2+H | 2+H | 3+H | 3+H

Once the envelopes have been filled, be sure to shuffle them so each player’s role is a secret to everyone else! Each player should get one envelope selected at random.

[b]Make sure you have the correct number of ordinary fascists in addition to Hitler![/b]

Once each player has been dealt a Role card and has looked at his Role card in secret, randomly select the first President. Pass the President both the Presidency and Chancellorship placards.

[b]For games of 5-6 players,[/b] give the following directions to all players:

   “Everybody close your eyes.”

   “Fascist and Hitler, open your eyes and acknowledge each other. ”

   [Take a long pause]

   “Everyone close your eyes and put your hands down.”

   “Everyone can open your eyes. If anyone is confused or something went wrong, please tell the group now.”

[b]For games of 7-10 players,[/b] give the following directions to all players:

   “Everybody close your eyes and extend your hand     into a fist in front of you.”

   “Hitler - keep your eyes closed but put your
     thumb out into a thumbs-up gesture.”

   “All fascists who are NOT Hitler should open
     their eyes and acknowledge each other.”

   “Fascists, take note of who has extended his or
     her thumb - that player is Hitler.”

   [Take a long pause]

   “Everyone close your eyes and put your hands
     down.”

   “Everyone can open your eyes. If anyone is
     confused or something went wrong, please tell
     the group now.”

40.title: Game Play
40.body:
[u][b]GAME PLAY[/b][/u]

Secret Hitler is played in rounds. Each round has an Election to form a government, a Legislative Session to enact a new policy, and an Executive Action to exercise governmental power.

[u][b]ELECTION[/b][/u]

You must choose a government to steer the country forward, but weigh the information you have carefully! if power falls into the wrong hands, it can spell disaster for the entire nation.

1. [u]PASS THE PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDACY[/u]
At the beginning of a new round, the Presidency placard moves clockwise to the next player, even if that player was in the last successfully elected government. This player is the new Presidential Candidate.

2. [u]NOMINATE A CHANCELLOR[/u]
The Presidential Candidate chooses a Chancellor Candidate by passing the Chancellorship placard to any other eligible player. Players who enacted the last policy are not eligible to be Chancellor Candidate.

[NB: In a [b]five-player game[/b], only the last active Chancellor is ineligible to be Chancellor Candidate; the last President may be nominated. In all other games, neither the last President nor the last Chancellor may be nominated.]

3. [u]VOTE ON THE GOVERNMENT[/u]

Once the Presidential Candidate has chosen a Chancellor Candidate, the whole table (including the Candidates) votes on the proposed government. Players indicate readiness to vote by extending their chosen Ballot card in front of them; discussion continues until every player is read to vote. Once every player is ready to vote, reveal your Ballot cards simultaneously so that everyone can see how you voted.

[b]If more than 50% of the group votes ja![/b], the Presidential Candidate and Chancellor Candidate become the President and Chancellor respectively.

If three or more fascist policies have already been enacted, ask the new Chancellor if he is Hitler; if he is Hitler, he reveals himself and the game immediately ends in a Fascist victory.

Otherwise, proceed to the Legislative Session.

[b]If the vote is a tie[/b], or if most players vote nein!, the Presidency placard moves clockwise to the next player and the election tracker is advanced by one election.

[b]Election Tracker:[/b] If the group rejects three governments in a row, a frustrated populace takes matters into its own hands. Reveal the policy on top of the Policy Draw Deck and enact it. Any power granted by this policy is ignored, but all players become eligible to hold the office of Chancellor for the next Election.

Reset the Election Tracker after a policy is enacted by the populace or a government is successfully elected.

50.title: Legislative Session
50.body:
[u][b]LEGISLATIVE SESSION[/b][/u]

The newly formed government must carefully navigate the demands of a restless populace, but watch them closely! Some governments catch a bad break, others take advantage of confusion to advance their agenda.

The President draws the top three cards from the Policy deck, looks at them in secret, and discards one Policy face down into the discard pile. He passes the remaining two cards to the Chancellor, who looks in secret, discards one Policy card face down, and enacts the remaining Policy card by placing it face up on the corresponding track.

The sanctity of the legislative session is of the utmost importance! Once it begins with the President drawing three Policy cards, the members of the government should be silent until a policy has been enacted; then they are free to share (or lie about) the details of the session. Remember, one or both of them may be Fascists attempting to deceive the group.

[b]Discarded policy cards should never be revealed to the group: you must rely on the word of the President and Chancellor, who are free to LIE.[/b]

If there are fewer than three cards remaining in the Policy deck at the end of a legislative session, shuffle them with the discard pile to create a new Policy deck. Unused policies should never be revealed, and they should not be simply placed on top of the new Policy deck.

If the government enacts a Liberal policy or a Fascist policy that grants no Presidential Power, begin a new round with a new Election. If the government enacts a Fascist Policy that grants an Presidential Power, proceed to the Executive Action.

60.title: Executive Action
60.body:
[u][b]EXECUTIVE ACTION[/b][/u]

Whether by fate or choice, the government has moved the country closer to Fascism and granted the President new powers to enforce his agenda.

The President is free to solicit input from whomever, and the group is free to offer whatever input it wants, but the final decision falls to the President alone. After the President takes an Executive Action, a new round begins with a new Election.

70.title: Presidential Powers
70.body:
[u][b]PRESIDENTIAL POWERS[/b][/u]

Look at the Fascist Track to determine which Presidential Power, if any, has been granted to the President. The President must use power granted to him.

[u]INVESTIGATE LOYALTY[/u]

The President investigates another player who has not yet been investigated by saying “I formally investigate [player name]”; that player passes his Party Membership Card (not his Secret Role Card) to the President, who checks that player’s loyalty in secret and then returns the Membership Card to the player. The President may share (or lie about!) the results of his investigation at his discretion.

[u]CALL SPECIAL ELECTION[/u]

The President chooses any other player at the table to be the next Presidential Candidate by passing that player the Presidency placard. That player nominates a Chancellor Candidate and the election proceeds as usual. After a Special Election, the Presidency returns to its original order.

[u]POLICY PEEK[/u]

The President secretly looks at the top three cards in the Policy deck and then returns them to the top of the deck without changing the order.

[u]EXECUTION[/u]

The President executes one player at the table by saying “I formally execute [player name].” If that player is Hitler, he reveals his Role Card and the game ends in a Liberal victory. If the executed player is not Hitler, he does not reveal his role or his loyalty. He is removed from the game
and may not speak, vote, or run for office.

[b]Veto Power:[/b] After five fascist policies have been enacted, the Executive branch gains much broader power over which policies are enacted. The President draws three policies, discards one, and
passes the remaining two to the Chancellor as usual. Then Chancellor may, instead of enacting either policy, say “I wish to veto this agenda.” If the President consents, both policies are discarded and the Presidency placard passes to the left as usual. If the President does not consent, the Chancellor must enact one of the two policies handed to him.

[b]Each use of the veto power represents an inactive government and advances the election tracker by one.[/b]

80.title: Strategy Notes
80.body:
[u][b]STRATEGY NOTES[/b][/u]

[b]>[/b] Everyone should claim to be a liberal. Since the Liberal team has a voting majority, it can easily shut out anyone who reveals he is a fascist. Liberals who claim to be fascists put their team at a significant disadvantage.

[b]>[/b] Slow the game down and discuss every decision. Consider what powers the president will gain if a fascist law is enacted, and ask potential presidents how they’ll use their powers. Liberals generally want to slow the game down to a crawl and think about every vote and decision. Fascists generally want to blow through the game and hope that the group makes sloppy mistakes.

[b]>[/b] Although they have a majority, it’s extremely hard for the Liberals to win. They need to establish trust with one another and use their voting power to prevent the fascists from getting elected and using the special powers of the President.

[b]>[/b] Pay careful attention to the position of players around the table and who’s going to be President next; you don’t want to be forced into a situation where you have to vote for a fascist ticket. The “special election” Presidential power is very powerful - make sure it doesn’t fall into the wrong hands!

[b]>[/b] Fascists should find a way to secretly signal their loyalty to Hitler - this could include nonverbal
communication or gameplay that protects Hitler.

[b]>[/b] In most cases, Hitler will want to play as a staunch
liberal - that way, the group will be amenable to installing him as Chancellor later in the game.

[b]>[/b] Fascists want to investigate Hitler early and name him as a liberal - this prevents a liberal President from outing Hitler as a fascist.

[b]>[/b] After the third Fascist policy has been enacted, the Fascists are poised to win the game by getting Hitler elected Chancellor. This is a very dangerous stage of the game for the Liberal team - the only way to know definitively if a player is Hitler is to elect them Chancellor and see if the game ends.

[b]>[/b] If a Fascist is president when the “kill” power is activated, he can eliminate a Lberal player under the guise of confusion. The Fascists can win the game this way by gaining a voting majority and installing Hitler as Chancellor, or by rejecting Candidates until the board fills with fascist policies.

81.title: CREDITS
81.body:
JUST TO CLARIFY AN IMPORTANT THING, I (FragaholiC) DID [u][i]NOT[/i][/u] DEVELOP THIS GAME.
All I did is a recreation of this game in TTS.

[b]Secret Hitler[/b] was designed by following people:

[b][i]Max Temkin[/i][/b] (Cards Against Humanity, Humans vs. Zombies) [b][i]Mike Boxleiter[/i][/b] (Solipskier, TouchTone), [b][i]Tommy Maranges[/i][/b] (Philosophy Bro) and illustrated by [b][i]Mackenzie Schubert[/i][/b] (Letter Tycoon, Penny Press).

[u]Secret Hitler homepage:[/u]
http://secrethitler.com

[u]Weekly developer podcast:[/u]
https://goatwolfandcabbage.simplecast.fm/

[u]Secret Hitler Kickstarter page:[/u]
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/maxtemkin/secret-hitler/description

[u]PNP PDF version provided by the developers:[/u]
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/502769/Secret_Hitler_Print_and_Play.pdf

[u]Secret Hitler PDF rules:[/u]
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/502769/Secret_Hitler_Rules.pdf

This mod was assembled and colored by [b][i]FragaholiC[/i][/b]. Textures were used from the print and play PDF of the successful kickstarter project "Secret Hitler". Backcovers not provided by the PNP version where compiled with assets of the kickstarter site.

Custom models like the ballot boxes, boards, bullets, placards, envelopes and the election tracker token are made by [b][i]FragaholiC[/i][/b]. Textures for the 3D models were partially used from the PNP PDF or from picutres of the Kickstarter page "Secret Hitler".

82.title: How to...
82.body:
[u]...distribute Secret Roles?[/u]
The boxes are labled and pre-packed for ease of use. In each box there are as many envelopes as the amout of players this box is labled for. In each envelope there are two ballot cards, one membership card and one role card (never ever show your role card to anyone during the game).

Chose a box to keep depending on the player count. Delete the boxes you don't need. Shuffle the box you kept [i]before[/i] everyone pulls out the envelopes with the roles in them. Put the envelopes on the right or left side of your seat name and pull out the 4 cards into your hand. Now you can flip the cards and look at them secretly.


[u]...secretly aknowledge other Fascists and Hitler?[/u]
● Everyone look at your Secret Role and put it face down in front of your hands.
● Everybody press 'B' for "Blindfold". ([b]hint: When you are blindfolded you don't see the blindfold and unblindfold messages, it actually works![/b])
● Depending on the player count:
       > 5-6 players: Hitler [i]and[/i] Fascist take off your             blindfolds!
       > 7-10 players: Fascists but [i]not[/i] Hitler take off            your blindfolds! 
● Fascists, flip [i]every[/i] Secret Role card to identify who the Fascists and Hitler is ([b]hint: 3D positional sound doesn't matter because every card is flipped[/b]). Flip the role cards back face down.
● When you are ready [i]every[/i] Fascist pings (tabs) once in the [i]middle[/i] of the table to signal that you are ready. After that, blindfold yourself again.
● On 3 everyone unblindfolds themselves ...1...2...3...unblindfold. If something went wrong you should say it now.
● Everybody put their secret roles and membership cards into their envelope.


[u]...determine randomly the first President?[/u]
There is a colored 8 sided die which has the colors of the player seats.

[u]...make placing cards on the board less tedious?[/u]
You don't need to rotate the cards to place them correctly on the boards or piles. This mod uses [i]snap points[/i] that drag and turn cards properly at a certain proximity. Just make sure the [i]shadows[/i] of the cards are somewhat near the center where they should be placed and the snap points will auto rotate the cards and place them precisely.

[u]...set precisely hidden zones?[/u]
In case you want to use hidden zones and do not want it to look like a mess, you may press space first and reposition your view with the WASD keys without looking around with the mouse. Than use the hidden zone tool to draw a zone which now should be perfectly parallel to the table edge.

[u]...remove the color marks (sword and leaves) on the table?[/u]
The color marks are there if you play without hidden zones and the cards are covering to much of the colored names.
In case you play with hidden zones and want to remove the color coding you can copy this link

http://lithi.io/g/tts/Secret.Hitler/Table/tex.secret.hitler.table.jpg

which is a texture and load it under
Host > Tables > Custom Rectangle
Just paste this link in and "import".
